title: The problem with Trump's call for Apple to make iPhones in the US
summary: President Trump says Apple (AAPL), along with other smartphone makers like Samsung (005930.KS), will have to pay a 25% tariff for every iPhone sold in the US that wasn't made domestically. Epistrophy Capital Research chief market strategist and host of "The Drill Down" podcast, Cory Johnson, joins Market Domination to discuss the dynamics that prevent Apple from making iPhones in the US. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

title: Apple's Tim Cook thought he had a Plan B for Trump's tariffs. It wasn't enough.
summary: Apple’s efforts to diversify its production away from China have been undermined by President Trump’s renewed threat to impose a 25% tariff on iPhones not made in the US.

title: Battle for AI dominance: OpenAI's moves target Apple & Google
summary: OpenAI's (OPAI.PVT) move to bring Jony Ive into the fold could reshape the artificial intelligence (AI) device race and put fresh pressure on Apple (AAPL). Hope King, founder of Macro Talk News and Yahoo Finance contributor, joins Catalysts to discuss how this partnership may disrupt big tech's grip on consumer AI. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to supercharge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth with 300 million weekly active users. 2024 was a big year for OpenAI, from its partnership with Apple for its generative AI offering, Apple Intelligence, the release of GPT-4o with voice capabilities, and the highly-anticipated launch of its text-to-video

title: EU tariffs, Ross and Deckers, Nvidia earnings: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) sink Friday morning after President Trump is now threatening a 50% tariff against EU countries. Both shares of retailer Ross Stores (ROST) and shoe brand Deckers Outdoor (DECK) are falling in pre-market trading. Nvidia (NVDA) is set to report its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, May 28. Catch Yahoo Finance's coverage of how the chip stock historically reacts to earnings and the areas that mattered the most for the semiconductor giant. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

title: Apple Stock Falls As Trump Threatens iPhone Tariff
summary: Apple stock fell Friday after President Donald Trump threatened to put a tariff on Apple iPhones of “at least 25%.”

title: Equity Markets Close Lower as Trump Proposes New Tariffs on EU, Apple
summary: US benchmark equity indexes closed lower on Friday, as President Donald Trump threatens new tariffs

title: Trump Threatens Fresh Tariffs on EU, iPhones and Rival Devices
summary: President Trump fired new salvos in the global trade war, threatening a 50% tariff on imported goods from the European Union and new duties on iPhones and other smartphones made overseas.

title: US Equities Markets End Lower Friday After Trump's EU, Apple Tariff Threats
summary: US benchmark equity indexes ended lower Friday as President Donald Trump threatened new tariffs against the EU and Apple.

title: Sector Update: Tech Stocks Fall Late Afternoon
summary: Tech stocks were in the red late Friday afternoon, with the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK)

title: Equity Markets Drop After Trump Threatens New Tariffs on EU, Apple
summary: US benchmark equity indexes are on track to close lower on Friday after the latest tariff threats by President Donald Trump.

title: Trump vows 50pc tariffs on EU as he rules out trade deal
summary: Donald Trump has vowed to impose 50 per cent tariffs on the EU from next month, as he ruled out striking a trade deal with Brussels.

title: Trump threatens to impose 50pc tariffs on EU as he rules out trade deal
summary: Donald Trump has threatened to impose 50 per cent tariffs on the EU from next month, as he ruled out striking a trade deal with Brussels.

title: Stocks to Watch: Apple, Booz Allen,  Constellation Energy, Intuit
summary: ↘️ Booz Allen (BAH): The company plans to cut roughly 2,500 jobs as it grapples with the effects of the Trump administration’s crackdown on federal contracting. Shares dropped 16%. ↘️ Apple (AAPL): President Trump racketed up pressure on Apple, saying iPhones manufactured abroad could face import taxes of at least 25%.

title: Trump Says Tariffs on the European Union Will Start June 1
summary: President Trump said the European Union would face a 50% tariff, and he threatened other companies like Apple and Samsung with tariffs for products made overseas.

title: Apple Negotiating Badly: D.A. Davidson's Gil Luria
summary: Apple could bring iPhone manufacturing to the U.S. in five years and should use that as a negotiating point with the Trump administration, says Gil Luria, Managing Director at D.A. Davidson. He speaks with Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Trump Threatens EU, Smartphones as Tariff Rhetoric Escalates

title: Trump threatens 25% tariff on Apple and says Samsung and other tech companies could be next
summary: President Donald Trump on Friday demanded Apple and other smartphone makers like Samsung make their phones in the United States or face a 25% tariff.

title: Apple Is Unlikely to Escape Tariffs This Time. Trump Is Doubling Down.
summary: Apple stock was dropping on Friday after President Donald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on its iPhones sold in the U.S. unless they are made in the U.S.
